= Class *jplex.xprototype.Element*  =

== Description ==
jPlex's XPrototype extended DOM Element

== Methods ==
<table border="1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="5">                                
<tr><td> *Signature* </td><td> *Return Type* </td><td> *Description* </td></tr>
<tr><td> `appendChildren(Elements)` </td><td> `Element` </td><td> Appends all elements listed as arguments to the DOM element<br />  - `Elements <List<Element>>` to add<br/></td></tr>
<tr><td> `bindKey(key, handler, config)` </td><td> `Element` </td><td> Bind a key event on an element<br />  - `key <int>` Key-Code (see Event)<br/> - `handler <Function>`<br/> - `config <Object>` This object is a boolean property hash object containing: `ctrl`, `shift`, `alt` and `preventDefault` (enough explicit)<br/></td></tr>
<tr><td> `IEFixCombobox()` </td><td> `void` </td><td> Inserts a hidden iframe behind the element to correct the Combobox bug (an absolute `div` goes under a comboxbox) 
that happens only in Internet Explorer 6. The Calendar component exploits this function to fix the bug for instance.<br /> </td></tr>
<tr><td> `isWithin(x, y)` </td><td> `Boolean` </td><td> Determines wheter the point of coordinates (x,y) on the page is within the element or not<br />  - `x <Integer>` Horizontal coordinate<br/> - `y <Integer>` Vertical coordinate<br/></td></tr>
<tr><td> `removeChildren()` </td><td> `Element` </td><td> Removes all children of the element<br /> </td></tr>
<tr><td> `unbindKey(key, modifiers)` </td><td> `Element` </td><td> Unbind a key on the element<br />  - `key <int>` Key-Code (see Event)<br/> - `modifiers <Object>` Same form as `config` in `bindKey`<br/></td></tr>

</table>
